PitchName.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   PitchName.h
00006 
00007   Dominic Mazzoni, Vaughan Johnson
00008 
00009   Utilities for converting from frequency to pitch 
00010   and from pitch to absolute (e.g., C4 for middle C) 
00011   or nominal (A through G#) pitch name.
00012 
00013 **********************************************************************/
00014 
00015 #ifndef __AUDACITY_PITCHNAME__
00016 #define __AUDACITY_PITCHNAME__
00017 
00018 #include <wx/defs.h>
00019 
00020 // Freq2Pitch takes a frequency in Hz (exponential scale relative to 
00021 // alphabetic pitch names) and returns a pitch ID number (linear 
00022 // scale), such that A440 (A4) is 57, middle C (C4) is 48, etc.
00023 // The offset to 57 is used to determine the register. 
00024 // Each register starts with C (e.g., for middle C and A440, 
00025 // it's register 4).
00026 float Freq2Pitch(float freq);
00027 
00028 // PitchIndex returns the [0,11] index for a float pitchNum, 
00029 // as per result from Freq2Pitch, corresponding to modulo 12 
00030 // of the integer part of (pitchNum + 0.5), so 0=C, 1=C#, etc.
00031 unsigned int PitchIndex(float pitchNum);
00032 
00033 // PitchName takes pitchNum (as per result from 
00034 // Freq2Pitch) and returns a standard pitch/note name [C, C#, etc.). 
00035 // Sharps are the default, unless, bWantFlats is true.
00036 wxChar * PitchName(float pitchNum, bool bWantFlats = false);
00037 
00038 // PitchName_Absolute does the same thing as PitchName, but appends 
00039 // the register number, e.g., instead of "C" it will return "C4" 
00040 // if the pitchNum corresonds to middle C.
00041 wxChar * PitchName_Absolute(float pitchNum, bool bWantFlats = false);
00042 
00043 #endif   // __AUDACITY_PITCHNAME__
00044

00051 // End:
